rule.name: so + adj/rb => so/RB
rule.example: He checked carefully, so that the mistakes were caught.

rule.name: Auld Lang Syne - title of a famous song

rule.example: Last Christmas I gave you my heart.

rule.name: 'sports' as adjective
rule.example: Getting a sports car is easy.

rule.name: even now
rule.example: The rainbow mural persevered, even now, thirty years later.
The rainbow mural persevered, even now, thirty years later.

rule.name: first/last thing does not need an article
Remove POS NN:U from adjectives
rule.example: When you have a choice about which brush to use, use the large.

rule.name: VB_OUT => not a verb
rule.example: He always left himself an out.

rule.name: VB_EXCEPT => not a verb
rule.example: On Thursday nobody except Charlie Coe was thinking of Charlie Coe.
He insisted to except against a witness.

rule.name: except do => verb
rule.example: There was nothing he could do except jump into the ditch.

rule.name: go + verb/nn => verb
rule.example: I told him, I want to go see the Buck house.

rule.name: hat in hand => no determiner required
at + nouns that require no determiner
beyond + nouns that require no determiner
beyond + nouns that require no determiner

rulegroup.name: by + nouns that require no determiner

rule.example: She played chess with him by postcard.
She played chess with him by way of the WWW site.

rulegroup.name: for + nouns that require no determiner

rule.example: But I never sent them for fear of what I might find.
I followed it word for word.

rulegroup.name: in + nouns that require no determiner

rule.example: In his youth, he was very young.
In summary, we might say that this argument is valid.
In his youth, he was very young.
In view of his weakness we might as well do nothing.
In his youth, he was very young.
Let's keep in touch with him.

rulegroup.name: on + nouns that require no determiner
out of + nouns that require no determiner

rule.example: Angela's life then spiraled out of control.

rule.name: under + nouns that require no determiner
with + nouns that require no determiner
rule.example: This includes issues that block access or interfere with access to the Web.

rule.name: without + nouns that require no determiner
rule.example: This is a war without end.

rule.name: look like - like => preposition
rule.example: I like the way he looks.

rule.name: kind of + adj/adv => no determiner required

rule.example: These two bad things are important.
No one trusts him any more.

rule.name: No one as personal pronoun
rule.example: One car, two dogs, seven cats
No one trusts him any more.
No one trusts him any more.

rule.name: Modal verb + verb/noun -> modal verb + verb
do/did/does + verb/noun -> VB
rule.example: I did notice what you said.

rule.name: do/did/does + not + verb/noun -> VB
rule.example: I did not notice what you said.

rule.name: don't/didn't/doesn't + verb/noun -> VB
rule.example: I didn't notice what you said.

rule.name: verb + well => well = RB
rule.example: It is well for us to remember.

rulegroup.name: in as noun -> in as preposition

rule.name: in as noun/preposition + the -> in as preposition
in as noun/preposition + uncountable noun -> in as preposition
in + adjective + noun
rule.example: The boss made him an in.

rule.name: the/these... + numeral + are (noun/verb) -> the... + numer + are (verb)

rule.example: Those present are all moved to tears.
Those present were all moved to tears.

rule.name: AM as NNP
rule.example: AM was the earliest modulation method.

rule.name: are (noun/verb) + adjective/gerund/preposition -> are (verb)
rule.example: What follows are the terms used by the Aikikai Foundation

rule.name: are + : + NNS
rule.example: Among the things that AI needs to represent are: objects, properties, categories and relations.

rule.name: committee/jury/class + VBP => NNS
rule.example: Traditionally, amphibians as a class are defined as all tetrapods with a larval stage.

rule.name: be + mine (verb/pron) -> mine (pron)
rule.example: The bags to your left are mine.
It is a can of soup.
It is a can of soup.
It is a can of soup.
The can can hold the water.

rule.name: times as noun pl
rule.example: I think at times it's very easy.

rule.name: means/verb + of =>noun
rule.example: The car is still the main means of transport.

rule.name: mere means => noun
rule.example: I don't know what it all means.
The money is a mere means.

rule.name: to ... means to ... => verb
rule.example: What it all means, I don't know.
To be a Christian means to say yes where I otherwise say no.

rule.name: ve -> have
rule.example: -ve is added in front of verbs

rule.name: ll -> will
rule.example: -ll is added in front of verbs

rule.name: let as a verb
rule.example: Let was an unincorporated community in Gilmer County, West Virginia, United States.
He was founder of the Chemical Society of London in 1841, being its first Treasurer and second President.
He was not founder of the Chemical Society of London in 1841, being its first Treasurer and second President.
He was not really founder of the Chemical Society of London in 1841, being its first Treasurer and second President.

rule.name: be + verb progressive/jj + noun countable => verb progressive
be + vbg/nn => vbg
rule.example: It's going to be a killer feature!

rule.name: be + better => .R
rule.example: It is better for us to remember.

rule.name: that MD + be -> MD
rule.example: That might be the most painful experience in my life.

rule.name: determiner + verb/NN -> NN
rule.example: These may be to bring about political change.
Anarcho-pacifism is a tendency that rejects violence.

rule.name: a/an/each + adj/nn + verb sing -> NN
rule.example: These may be to bring about political change.

rule.name: a/an/each + nn + verb sing/noun pl -> verb sing
rule.example: These may be to bring about political change.

rule.name: SENT_START + the + nn/jj + verb sing => nn
rule.example: The Boss wants performance, not gripes.

rule.name: determiner + adj + verb/NN -> NN
rule.example: These may be to bring about political change.
No one trusts him any more.
The Atlantic harbors petroleum and gas fields.
Panovsky's notion of the dialectic makes history follow a predetermined course.
Today, the black dogs barks loudly.
Undoubtedly, the general will is an important notion in Rousseau.

rule.name: determiner + adj/noun + preposition => noun
rule.example: A short while later, Anders also went to sleep.

rule.name: verb + pronoun + inconsistent verb > noun
rule.example: That doesn't give you grounds for complaining.
How much we pay you depends on your skill.

rule.name: remove DT from 'an' used instead of 'and'
The World War 1/2 =>NNP
rule.example: Another world would be a catastrophe.

rule.name: A priori / posteriori
rule.example: This is an a priori truth.

rule.name: NNP/VB + NNP -> NNP
rule.example: It is in many Caribbean and Latin American countries...

rule.name: Uppercase word/NNP|NN -> NNP
rule.example: They looked at the ruins of the old Roman wall on the lower Via Veneto.
His name was Bobby Brown and he acted as a clerk.

rule.name: Uppercase word/no tag + 's -> NNP
rule.example: Fodor's concept of modularity is narrow.

rule.name: Uppercase word/no tag + uppercase word -> NNP
I as Roman number in king names
rule.example: Henry I is crowned King of England in Westminster Abbey.

rule.name: NNP/NNS -> NNP if followed by singular verb
DT|JJ + JJ + NN/VBP -> NN
rule.example: His friend is now in England.
The elephant swings its long nose.
A rolling stone gathers no moss.

rule.name: DT|JJ + JJ + end of phrase -> NN
those/these + VBN/NN + not a noun -> VBN
rule.example: Those illustrated are a prime example.

rule.name: those/these + so + VBN/VBD/JJ -> so = JJ
rule.example: It also made him feel hate, sincere hate, for those so labeled.

rule.name: JJ_NN -> JJ
rule.example: I have a lot of red wine.

rule.name: required to
rule.example: The space required to store the input numbers is not counted.
He required to store the input numbers.

rulegroup.name: DT + whatever/NN + end of phrase -> NN

rule.name: plural noun + that/which etc. + plural verb/nn => verb
rule.example: I didn't know that they were happy.
Certain frogs that lay eggs underground have unpigmented eggs.

rule.name: PRP + VBZ/NNS -> VBZ
rule.example: He was determined to be someone.
No one trusts him any more.

rule.name: WDT/WP ->WDT
rule.example: What kind of bread is this?

rule.name: WDT/WP ->WP
rule.example: What kind of bread is this?

rule.name: That + NN ->DT
rule.example: That kind of bread is stale.
This is how 'unconscious' knowledge is posited.
This is how 'unconscious' knowledge is posited.
Burke-rostagno the Richard S. Burkes' home in Wayne may be the setting for the wedding.

rule.name: the + adverb/noun + the -> noun
rule.example: The really the interesting thing is this.
In the meanwhile the whole situation changed.

rule.name: pronoun + vbn/nn->vbn
rule.example: Have you thought of any good plans?

rule.name: vb->vbp
rule.example: Yes, actually we claim that this is true.

rule.name: noun phrase end -> NN
rule.example: Doubled consonants count as two consonants.
The Beatles play to nearly 60,000 fans at Shea Stadium.
Morroco's disputed claim to portions of Algeria.

rule.name: noun/verb after a plural NP -> verb
rule.example: So Rand fell into a severe depression.
...was assigned to duty in northern Virginia while the Army of the Potomac conducted the Peninsula.
What we know comes from a book.

rule.name: Modal verb + plural noun/vbz + plural verb => NNS
rule.example: Confederate commanders would need it should troops pass that way in retreat.
Somebody else's hypothesis needs to be tested.

rule.name: help + verb/noun + determiner
rule.example: Our army helped train the Armenian soldiers.

rule.name: saw him
rule.example: The years 1812 and 1813 saw him in Germany and France again

rule.name: Past Participle
rule.example: Have you liked Dutch jazz music?

rule.name: companies: verb to noun if preceded by adj
have palm trees - palm is a noun
as
rule.example: He is as tall as my friend.

rule.name: as
rule.example: He is as tall as my friend.

rule.name: as
rule.example: He is as tall as my friend.

rule.name: better than
rule.example: This year's profits should better last year's by a wide margin.
She likes Hiroshima better than any other city.

rule.name: Possesive pronoun + verb/noun =>noun
rule.example: I do what I want to.
They should make up their minds!
Don't do anything against my will.

rule.name: Possesive pronoun + verb/noun + verb sing =>noun
rule.example: I do what I want to.
Your singing puts professional singers to shame.

rule.name: Possesive pronoun + verb/noun + verb sing =>noun
rule.example: I do what I want to.

rule.name: Possesive pronoun + adj/noun =>noun
rule.example: I do what I want to.

rule.name: verb singular/noun + det + noun plural or uncountable => verb
Adjective + verb singular/plural noun => noun
rule.example: Hard work causes fitness and vice versa.

rule.name: Plural determiners + noun plur/vb sg => noun plur
rule.example: It depends whose hands it's in.

rule.name: nouns in coordination
rule.example: They are now man and wife duly married.

rule.name: Prepositional quantifiers + noun plur/vb sg = >noun plur
rule.example: They cut a lot of hands.

rule.name: most + verb in plural
rule.example: Most of his writing is rubbish.
Most are around 40-50 μm in diameter.

rule.name: less as connective (revenues less expenses)
rule.example: This is defined as indirect taxes less subsidies.

rule.name: up to - not a noun
rule.example: We all have ups and downs.

rule.name: make/get/do + it + verb/JJ => JJ
rule.example: We thought it wrong to leave her alone.

rule.name: know/stand + xx + better => RBR
rule.example: We need to better the lot of the suburban commuter.
Later, you shall know it better.

rule.name: even as a verb
rule.example: Even if you're right, we need to do this.
Even if you're right, we need to even out accounts.
Even if you're right, we need to do this.
Even if you're right, he wants to get even for the insult.
Even if you're right, we need to do this.
It even made an appearance at the Woodstock Music Festival.
Even if you're right, we need to do this.
It even made an appearance at the Woodstock Music Festival.

rule.name: long as JJ
rule.example: You should have completed it long ago.
You should have completed it long time ago.

rule.name: live as JJ
rule.example: He performed it live in Stockholm.

rule.name: still/further/long + verb = rb
rule.example: Still, I need to do a lot of things.
Much of the diet involved the use of peppers, as it still does today.

rule.name: a + rb/jj + nn => jj
rule.example: It was after a further investigation.

rule.name: best + verb = rb
rule.example: Still, I need to do a lot of things.
This best exhibits the features of the snake oil.

rulegroup.name: Phrases of the form similar to: step by step

rule.example: These are the steps you need to make.

rule.name: further as adjective
rule.example: Further Spanish attacks led by Hugo of Moncada in 1519 were harsh.

rule.name: forward as adverb
rule.example: She was a rude, forward child.

rule.name: sort + of => not a verb
rule.example: I sort the entries in the dictionary.
But he sort of acted like he didn't care.

rule.name: I. as an abbreviation
rule.example: The I. A. P. A. is a reflection of the problems.

rule.name: I Ching
rule.example: But a tossing of coins, with perhaps the added safeguard of reference to the oracles of the I Ching, the Chinese Book Of Changes, dictates the handling of the chosen materials.
It was a gift for he.
It is nice, for he does a lot of nice things.
It was a gift for he.
It is nice, for they do a lot of nice things.

rule.name: preposition + training =>noun
rule.example: We need to to pay for training to meet national skilled manpower needs.

rule.name: Number + Uppercase word/no tag + uppercase word -> immunize
